dialogue: Na wai óki i o mai?
Na Táka ra óki
E tángata pai ra nei ía?
E tángata pai; e tángata hóha.
translation: A good man; a generous man.

dialogue: Ke ihéa kóia tóna káinga?
Ke Port Jákson ra óki; ke Paramáta.
Kóa tai óti koe ki reira?
Kóa tai ra óki 'au
I nahéa?
I te e áutóke ra óki: ka tai áno 'au ka e óki mai.
translation: It was in winter: just now I am returned here.

dialogue: E. wahíne óti ta Táka?
E wahíne ra óki tana.
Tóko hía ána tamaníki?
Tóko óno
E'aha tána máhinga?
E karakía ra óki ki tóna Atúa.
translation: A praying to, or calling upon his God.

dialogue: E tohúnga pe óki ía?
E tohúnga ra óki
Ko wai óld tóna Atúa?
Ko Jihóva ra óki; ko Jizus Kraist; ko te Waidúa pai.
translation: Jehovah, Jesus Christ, the Good Spirit.

dialogue: E tódu ra nei énei Atúa?
E téka. Ko táhi ra óki rátu; ko Jihóva ra óki to rátu ingóa waka éra éra.
translation: No. They are one; Jehovah is their great name.

dialogue: E aire ána koe?
E aire ána ra óki 'au. Apópo ka e óki mai, kía wakáko táu'.
translation: I am moving. To-morrow return back, when thou and I will teach.

dialogue: Aire átu ra
I ko na ra
Aire mai rá; aire mai; aire mai! Té na ra ko koe.
translation: Come cheerly; come, come! Health to thee.

dialogue: E'mara má! nohéa ténei kai?
No te Wai Máte
Na e O'ngi óki i ó mai ki á kodúa?
translation: Did e O'ngi give' it you?

dialogue: Na tána wahíne ra óki i ó mai. Ke táwahi ra óki e O'ngi, ke Ingland. Ki á no koe i róngo nóa?
translation: His wife gave it to us. e O'ngi is on the other side of the water, in England, Have you not heard?

dialogue: Ki a no 'au i róngo nóa.
Kóa díro ke ráia; kóa tai ke, méa ka e óki mai.
translation: He has been gone some time: has arrived; is about to return.

dialogue: A'i! k'wai tóna kaipúke i éke ai ía?
translation: Indeed! What ship did he embark in?

dialogue: Ko Niw Zílandar ra óki.
K'wai ra te rangatíra o te kaipúke nei?
Ko Kaptan ——
K'wai ra to e O'ngie O'a?
Ko Waikáto
Na wai óti i kitéa ta ráua ékenga ki dúnga ki te kaipúke?
translation: Who attended their embarkation on board the ship?

dialogue: Ko té aha óti rátu ki Ingland?
translation: What are they going to do in England?

dialogue: Ko te títiro átu óki ki te pai o te wenúa óki, ki te ánga o te pákeha óki, ki te tíni o te tángata óki.
translation: To see the goodness of the land, the occupations of the people, the number of the inhabitants.

dialogue: E e óki mai ána rátu katóa?
E e óki mai ána ra óki rátu. E ánga mai ána pe óki rátu ki nga tamaníki, mé aki te tángata máodi. E kóre pe óki rátu eóti átu.
translation: They return. They perhaps regard their children, and the people of their country. Perhaps they will not remain a-broad.

dialogue: Méa pai ra. Ahéa rátu e e óki mai ai?
A te rau máti ra óki; a te nga údu.
E'koro! ko koe téna?
Ko 'au ra óki. No te rápu ra óki 'au ki tóku kákahu kóa diro i te taéhaé.
translation: It is. I have been searching for my garment which had been stolen.

dialogue: Na wai óki i taéhaé?
Na te mánu wídi ra óki; na te tángata.
Ka kíte' óti koe?
Ka kíte' ra óki 'au; e kóre e waka e óki mai.
translation: I have: (he) will not return it.

dialogue: Aíre e óki koe, meangátu.
translation: Go again, and ask for it.

dialogue: Ka róngo pe óki te tángata ki á koe?
translation: Perhaps the man would hear thee?

dialogue: Aire táua. Na! ka díro mai.
translation: Let us go. See! (I have) got it.

dialogue: Maua ráwa koe.
translation: Thou and I are good friends.

dialogue: E'aha kóia tóu méa e óko?
E kapána ra óki
. E'aha te útu?
translation: What is the exchange, or price?

dialogue: E pu ra óki
E hía kéte?
E díma te kau ra óki.
Ter'hía mai, (for tére hía mai).
Na wai kóia enei pórka?
Na ténei tángata
Máku óki e e óko ki á ía.
translation: I will purchase them from him.

dialogue: E'aha táu méa e óko?
E tóki, e kahédu, epúka, e kóta, me téra átu.
translation: Axes, hogs, spades, plane irons, and other things.

dialogue: E hía óu tóki mo áku porka?
translation: How many axes for my hogs?

dialogue: Ka wá
Té na; ó mai
Ka máte óki 'au e táhi rákau mo tóku kaipúke.
translation: I want some timber for my ship.

dialogue: E hía rákau?
E dúa ra te kau
E'aha kóia tóu méa e óko ki te rákau?
translation: What hast thou to exchange for trees?

dialogue: E tóki ra
E hía tóki?
E íwa
Máku e túa e táhi rákau móu ne?
translation: Shall I fell some trees for thee?

dialogue: Máu ra óki
Ka hoi ra óki 'au
Hoi átu ra!
Ka óre óu rákau, E' mara?
Ka óre ra óki e rákau ki tóku káinga. E káinga rákau kóre ra óki tóku.
Kohéa koe?
Ko Tepúna ra óki 'au.
Ahéa koe e pátu ki te tóki?
Ná! Ki a wai kúmara ki te wáre ka pátu ra óki 'au.
translation: See! When there are sweet potatoes in the house, I will make them.

dialogue: E íaha táu méanga mai ki 'au?
Ka óre; e ánga no áno.
Nohéa koe?
No te móana ra óki; no te hí.
translation: I am come from the sea; from fishing.

dialogue: E íka áno?
E íka ra óki, e tíni: e kóre e máunu.
translation: There are fish, very many: they will not bite.

dialogue: E'aha te méa máunu?
E ngáko pórka ra óki.
Méa kíno, émara: e íka te méa pai.
translation: A bad thing, Sir: fish is better.

dialogue: Kóia ra. Ka óre áku; e porka táku.
translation: Truly. I have none; mine is pork.

dialogue: Ténei te íka móu
translation: Here is some fish for thee.

dialogue: I ko nei koe né? Ki a e óki mai 'au, ka kórero táu'.
translation: Wilt thou abide here? When I return, we will converse.

dialogue: Aire ra; ki e á e óro.
E'mara ma! ma wai óki e tá tá e táhi wáhia mo tóku wáre?
translation: O sirs! who will cut fire: wood for my house?

dialogue: Ma máua ko Tékeha
Ténei nga tóki ma kodúa e óroi, e pu e óki áno.
translation: These are the axes: you two grind them, they are blunt.

dialogue: E'aha te útu mo máua, mo te tángata tá tá?
translation: What will be given us, who cut the fire-wood?

dialogue: E tóki ra óki
Ma wai óti e tére?
Ma nga tíni kotíro ra óki.
E'aha te útu mo te kai tére?
E matau ra óki
E ói?
E ói, Méa pai ra óki; méa núi; e matau ko táhi, me te kai kadúa, ka óra.
translation: It is all. A good thing, a great thing; a fish-hook one, victuals two, satisfied.

dialogue: Ka aire tátu, émara ma, ki te korohá.
translation: Let us go, Sirs, into the bush.

dialogue: Ko té aha óti i reira?
Ko te tákaro
E wátu ána ra óki 'au ki táku kakahu; e kóre 'au e tai.
translation: I am working at my garment; I will not go.

dialogue: Ahéa óti ai?
Méa ka óti kóia péa, á te ai ai óti ai.
translation: I have nearly finished: I finish it in the evening.

dialogue: Ma táua e wátu né?
translation: Let us both work; shall we?

dialogue: Aire mai ra. Tenei tóu míro míro.
translation: Come. Here is three for thee.

dialogue: Ná! Ka óti; ka aire táu'.
translation: Lo! it is finished; let us go?

dialogue: O átu ra
O mai tóku wítiki
Ténei ra
Ko wai kóia te pá o Waikáto?
translation: What is the name of Waikáto's village?

dialogue: Ko Rangi Houa ra óki.
E nóho ána óti te pákeha ki reira?
E nóho ána ra óki ki Hóyi.
E íwi áta wai óti te tángata máodi ki te pákeha?
translation: Do the people of the land deal peaceably with the Europeans?

dialogue: E íwi áta wai ra óki; e pai ána; ka óre ra óki e dídinga, ka óre e tútu, ka óre e méa.
translation: The people behave peaceably: they are pleased: there is no quarrelling, teazing, or any thing.

dialogue: Ka máodi tía te pákeha?
K'wai óki 'au ka kíte'?
Ke ihéa kóia tóa tuakúna?
Ke Wánga róa
Eahána ía i reira?
E ádu ádu wahíne ána.
K'wai ra te wahíne?
Ko méa; ko Téku
E pai ána óti te matúa?
E pai ána ra óki ía: e dídi ána te tungáne
translation: He is agreeable: the brother is displeased.

dialogue: E kóre te tungáne e tukúa?
E kóre.
E'aha tána méa dídi?
translation: What is the cause of his anger?

dialogue: E útu kóre ra óki: ka óre e tuwahíne no te táne.
translation: There is no person in exchange. The intended husband has no sister.

dialogue: Nohéa kodúa?
No E O'ki A'nga, ko máua, ko Túma.
translation: We are from E Oki Anga, I and Tuma.

dialogue: Ka kíte' óti koe te wáha pu?
translation: Hast thou seen the heads of the harbour?

dialogue: Ka kíte' ra óki 'au
Ka tápoko te kaipúke o Yuropi?
Pe óki; ka tápoko ra nei, ka óre ra nei.
translation: Perhaps so; perhaps enter, perhaps not.

dialogue: E áwa pai óti E O'ki A'nga?
translation: Is E Oki Anga a fine river?

dialogue: E áwa pai ra óki; e áwa róa; e áwahohónu.
translation: A fine river; a long river; a deep river.

dialogue: K'wai ra te tángata i árahi kodúa ki reira?
Ko Waikáto ra óki, ko ráua ko Ngau.
E'aha te útu' ki te kai árahi kodúa?
translation: What did you give to your conductors?

dialogue: Ka óre ra óki e útu'. E aire ána ráua óki ki a kíte' to ráua íwi.
translation: We gave nothing. They were going to see their tribe.

dialogue: K'wai ra te ránga tíra o te wáha pu?
translation: Who is the proprietor of the heads of the river?

dialogue: Ko Te Mángina ra óki.
E Tohúnga pe óki ía?
E Tohúnga ra óki: e karakía ána ra óki ki te ngádu.
translation: A priest. He invokes the waves.

dialogue: K'wai óki te ránga tíra o Pá Kanai?
translation: Who is the chief of Pá Kanai.

dialogue: Ko te I'ka ra óki
E hía kai ána tóku
Ténei te kai máu
translation: There is some food for thee.

dialogue: Máku te táhi táro
Ka óre áku, e kai máodi táku.
translation: I have none. I have only sweet potatoes.

dialogue: E táhi wai móku
Ténei te wai móu: ínu mía koe.
translation: Here is water for thee: drink thou.

dialogue: Ka makúna ra óki 'au
Máku te táhi matau
Ka óre áku matau
Móku te táhi tóki
E'aha táu méa kadíro i 'au, o átu tóku tóki ki á koe?
translation: What hast thou given me, that I should give my axe to thee?

dialogue: Ka óre. Mo te ó mai nóa ra óki.
translation: Nothing. I want it for nothing.

dialogue: E ai na!
Ka máte 'au e táhi rákau mo tóku wáre?
translation: I am in want of timber for my house.

dialogue: E káinga rákau ra óki tóku káinga.
translation: There is wood at my place.

dialogue: E kóre óti koe e pai kía túa e táhi rákau móku?
translation: Art not thou willing to fell some wood for me?

dialogue: E pai ána ra óki 'au. E'aha te útu'?
translation: I am willing. What is the exchange for it?

dialogue: E tóki ra óki
Kía kíte' 'au, máku e eréa.
translation: Let me see them, and mark them.

dialogue: Ténei ra
E'aha te útu' mo te kai tó tó?
translation: What wilt thou give the draggers?

dialogue: E kapána ra óki, e matau.
Méa pai ra
Ahéa tóhia mai te rákau?
translation: When wilt thou bring the timber?

dialogue: A te táhi ra; á wáke
translation: The day after tomorrow, or the next day.

dialogue: Ki e á e óro, émara! e pórangi ána ra óki 'au ki a óti
translation: Make haste, Sir! I am in haste to finish my house.

dialogue: Ahéa óti ai?
Ki a wai rákau ki tóku káinga; na! ka óti ra.
translation: When there is timber at my place. See! It will finish.

dialogue: Móku te táhi kapána?
Mo wai óti te kapána?
Mo te kai tó tó ra óki.
E hía óti kéte?
E óno ra óki. Ka óre e kínake, e táhi porka ra nei, e méa móro íti?
translation: Sir! Is there no food to make the potatoes palatable; perhaps a small bit of pork?

dialogue: Ténei te porka. E ói.
translation: Here is the pork: that's all.

dialogue: I ko ná ra!
Hoi átu ra!
Ka ránga tía te ánga tamaníki, kía aire mai, kía karakía.
translation: Tell the boys to come and read?

dialogue: E aire mai ána ra óki rátu.
Aire mai ra. Máu óki e karakía ki múa.
E mátau ána pe óki 'au?
Ka mátau ra óki koe
E nóho mádie, ékoro má, kaua e tutú?
translation: Sit still, scholars. Do not make a noise.

dialogue: Ka túdi tóku táringa, ékoro ma: ki ai 'au e róngo.
translation: My ears are confused. I do not yet hear.

dialogue: E róngo ána óti koe?
Ka róngo ra óki 'au
Ka pai ra óki 'au ki ténei búka búka.
translation: I am fond of this book.
